items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Llanymynech river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible Monday overnight.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Predicted peaks:-  Llanymynech 3.7m to 4.0m Monday overnight.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are liaising with emergency services and or Local Authorities.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 10am on 16/09/25, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Lancashire, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
Persistent rainfall throughout the day has caused river levels to rise. Rainfall is expected to continue into the evening and overnight with river levels expected to reach flood alert level from 5:30PM on 15/09/2025. Levels will remain high throughout the evening.

This message will be updated by 10AM on 16/09/2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Flooding is possible this morning and through to this afternoon, Monday 15/09/2025. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Ure, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around The River Ure and tributaries, from its source downstream to Kilgram. Rainfall is expected throughout the day and into this evening. We are closely monitoring the situation and do not expect to issue any flood warnings at this time. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourse and do not attempt to walk, drive or cycle through flood water. Take care and consider activating your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 21:00 on Monday 15/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible from 6:00 PM on 15/09/2025.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Kent and Bela and other watercourses, from Kentmere to Silverdale including low lying areas around Staveley, Burneside, Kendal, Milnthorpe and Beetham.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise in response to recent heavy rainfall. Flooding is possible this evening,  Monday,  15/09/2025. Areas most at risk include low lying agricultural land and possibly minor roads in the valley floor, including Buckden, Bolton Abbey and Ilkley.  We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue Flood Warnings if necessary. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk, drive or cycle through flood water. Take care and consider activating your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 07:00 am on Tuesday, 16/09/25 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
We continue to monitor the situation. Our incident response staff are actively monitoring river levels and the weather forecast.
Please avoid contact with flood water.

Rising river levels this evening may lead to flooding.
Areas most at risk include River Eden and its tributaries from its confluence with the River Irthing through Crosby-on-Eden and Carlisle to the Solway Firth at Rockcliffe.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

Heavy rainfall in the early hours of this morning has caused rising river levels which may lead to flooding of land and road. Flooding is possible from 10:00 AM today 15/09/2025.

Areas most at risk include Rivers Esk and Irthing and other watercourses, including low lying areas around Longtown and Brampton.

Persistent rainfall is expected to continue throughout the day today into the evening.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ure, Swinney Beck, Bishop Monkton Beck, River Skell, River Laver, River Tutt, Stainley Beck

items.message: Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding as a result of recent heavy rain. Flooding is possible this evening, Monday 15/09/2025 and through to tomorrow morning, Tuesday, 16/09/2025. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Skell, River Ure, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low-lying land including agricultural land and local roads in the areas around Masham, Boroughbridge, Aldborough and Bishop Monkton. We are closely monitoring the situation and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 21:00 on Monday, 15/09/25, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
Heavy rainfall this morning and early this afternoon has caused rising river levels which may lead to flooding of land and road. Flooding is possible from 14:00 PM today,15/09/2025.

Areas most at risk include Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel.

Persistent heavy showers are expected to continue throughout the afternoon and overnight.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
Further flooding is possible overnight as river levels are rising steadily due to heavy rainfall.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

Persistent rainfall throughout the day has caused river levels to rise. Flooding is possible this evening from 6PM. Rainfall is expected to continue into the evening and overnight and river levels are expected to reach flood alert level from 06:00PM on 15/09/2025. Levels will remain high until the morning.

This message will be updated by 10AM on 16/09/2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Wharfe, Kel Beck, Town Beck, Collingham Beck, Fir Green Beck, Bramham Beck

items.message: River levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Flooding is possible tomorrow morning, Tuesday 16/09/2025. Areas most at risk include the Lower River Wharfe and its tributaries from Otley to upstream of Ulleskelf, including Tadcaster. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue Flood Warnings if necessary. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk, drive or cycle through flood water. Take care and consider activating your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 07:30 am on Tuesday, 16/09/25 or as the situation changes.

River and Lake levels are rising due to todayâ€™s heavy rainfall and flooding is expected from 7 PM this evening,15/09/2025.

Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site.
 
Further heavy showers are forecast this evening and overnight tonight. We will continue to monitor rainfall, river, and lake levels.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water, and avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 8:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

Heavy rainfall in the early hours of this morning has caused rising river levels which may lead to flooding of land and road. Flooding is possible from 9:00 AM today 15/09/2025.

Areas most at risk include Rivers Wampool and Ellen and other watercourses, from Dalston to Maryport including low lying areas around Wigton, Abbeytown, Silloth, Allonby, Aspatria and Dearham.
 
Persistent rainfall is expected to continue throughout the day today into the evening.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Greta, St Johns Beck and Bassenthwaite Lake

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Greta, St Johns Beck, Glendermackin

items.message:
Rising river levels this evening may lead to flooding.
Areas most at risk include River Derwent from Keswick to Bassenthwaite. The Rivers Greta, Glenderamackin and St Johns Beck including Keswick.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/09/2025, or as the situation changes.
